meanings.definition: The male head of a family or tribe.
meanings.sent1: The patriarch of our family always leads the holiday celebrations.
meanings.sent2: In many cultures, the patriarch is responsible for making important decisions.
meanings.sent3: The patriarch jokingly declared himself the king of the backyard barbecue.
meanings.sent4: He stood tall like a patriarch, guiding his family through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The image of the patriarch sitting by the fireplace will forever be etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: A man who is a founder or father figure.
meanings.sent1: As a patriarch of the community, he was respected by all.
meanings.sent2: The patriarch of the company started the business from scratch.
meanings.sent3: The wise old patriarch shared his stories with the young children.
meanings.sent4: He was a patriarch in the world of literature, inspiring many writers.
meanings.sent5: The patriarch's words of wisdom echoed through the generations.

meanings.definition: A bishop in the Eastern Orthodox Church.
meanings.sent1: The patriarch led the church service with grace and solemnity.
meanings.sent2: In the Eastern Orthodox Church, the patriarch plays a significant role.
meanings.sent3: The patriarch accidentally spilled the incense during the ceremony.
meanings.sent4: His presence in the church was as powerful as a patriarch in ancient times.
meanings.sent5: The patriarch's voice resonated through the walls of the cathedral.
